info.headline: Extreme Fire Danger issued April 14 at 4:38AM CDT by NWS Sioux Falls
info.description: .DISCUSSION... Issued at 355 AM CDT Thu Apr 14 2022 Dry antecedent conditions continue to provide dry fuels for fires today. Relative humidity`s fall to the 20s and possibly teens if efficient mixing can occur this afternoon along with strong westerly winds gusting above 45 mph all but make for critical fire danger conditions. Have issued a red flag warning from a line from Corsica, SD to Harrisburg SD, to Spencer, IA and south. The red flag warning is in effect from noon to 9 pm this evening. Tomorrow is a bit questionable for fire danger concerns. While relative humidity`s will again be in the low 20s, winds may be too light to issue any red flag warnings. Will monitor trends to see if fire weather headlines will be needed for Friday. Consider postponing burning due to the very high or extreme fire danger. ...EXTREME FIRE DANGER... The Grassland Fire Danger Index will reach the extreme category this afternoon. Extreme weather conditions and very low moisture content of grasses, and other dry organic material on the ground, indicate that critical burning conditions exist. All fires have the potential to become large and spread quickly, becoming erratic with extreme behavioral characteristics. No outdoor burning should take place. OUTLOOK FOR FRIDAY AFTERNOON...The Grassland Fire Danger Index will reach the high category. The grassland fire danger product reflects fire danger for native grasses. It is not intended for cured agricultural crops, nor will it reflect conditions in road ditches which have been mowed.
